metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8061 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: drivers/media/usb/dvb-usb/dvb-usb-firmware.c in the Linux kernel 4.9.x and4.10.x before 4.10.7 interacts incorrectly with the CONFIG_VMAP_STACKoption, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (system crashor memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact byleveraging use of more than one virtual page for a DMA scatterlist.

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
